page.title: 17SOUTH MARSTON NOTES
page.content: Most of the houses were built in the 20th century but many were built in the 19th century. Many of the Victorian houses are made of stone but some are made of bricks. There are 201 houses in the villlage and a large proportion are detached. Two new estates have been built within the last 18 months, one of which is on the site of the old Manor House. Church Farm is one of the few surviving pre-Victorian houses. There are some old South Marston families still living here today. The most notable are the{Sansums}and the{Larges. Our most notable personality was {Alfred Williams,}"the Hammerman Poet", who died in 1930. Alfred built his own house from material taken from a derelict lock of the Wilts & Berks Canal. The house survives today and is called{"Ranikhet".
